metadata.dc:author: Torres-Machí, M L
Suárez-Romero, V
Ojeda, N
Caramés, M A
Medina-Ramírez, C
Rodríguez-Pérez, A
metadata.dc:description: We report the case of a man diagnosed with cervical spinal stenosis who underwent a C3-C6 bilateral laminectomy. In the immediate postoperative period he developed subcutaneous emphysema and pneumomediastinum caused by tracheal laceration. Continuous airflow (1 L x min(-1)) through the outer cuff was applied during the operation to compensate for air leak when loss of balloon cuff pressure was detected.
metadata.dc:title: Laceración traqueal tras intubación y aplicación de flujo contínuo de aire por el manguito externo del tubo endotraqueal.
[Tracheal laceration after intubation and application of continuous airflow through the outer cuff of the tracheal tube].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de anestesiologia y reanimacion
